revised_title: Hauksbee's Experiments on Mercurial Phosphorus and Light Production
tldr: In a series of experiments, Hauksbee demonstrated that light can be produced from mercury by passing air through its body in a vacuum. He also discovered that a rarefied medium and proper motion are necessary for the production of mercurial phosphorescence. These findings contributed to the understanding of light and the properties of rarefied gases.
